channel.title: Compile errors, ewwwww

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww
item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:11, topic:297427”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=393463.msg2927940#msg2927940 date=1251118344]
[b]I cannot help you as there is only so much I can do without having your server source right infront of me.
[/quote]
Please read.[/quote]

Same to you:

[code] public void attackPlayer(Player p) {
try {
for (Player p2 : World.getInstance().getPlayerList()) {
if (p == null || p2 == null) {
System.out.println(“p/p2 = null”);
return;
}
if (p.getEquipment().get(3).getDefinition().getId() == 773) {
int rangeDamage = 255;
int meleeDamage = 255;
} else {
int rangeDamage = Misc.random(p.MaxHitRange());
int meleeDamage = Misc.random(p.MaxHitMelee());
}

			if (p2.getIndex() == p.enemyIndex) {[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww

item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

Actually no, it was there, I just changed it. I pasted where that’s defined, now can I get some help?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

No, it says:

symbol  : variable rangeDamage

The variable rangeDamage is the symbol that doesn’t exist. I cannot help you as there is only so much I can do without having your server source right infront of me. The chances are you ripped this out of something else, that’s why you’re getting the errors.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

It’s pointing at the letter r in all of them, d’you mind actually being helpful? …[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 24, 2009, 06:51:34 am[/size][hr]Currently I have this:

[code] public void attackPlayer(Player p) {
try {
for (Player p2 : World.getInstance().getPlayerList()) {
if (p == null || p2 == null) {
System.out.println(“p/p2 = null”);
return;
}
if (p.getEquipment().get(3).getDefinition().getId() == 773) {
int rangeDamage = 255;
int meleeDamage = 255;
} else {
int rangeDamage = Misc.random(p.MaxHitRange());
int meleeDamage = Misc.random(p.MaxHitMelee());
}

			if (p2.getIndex() == p.enemyIndex) {[/code]

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Show us the errors if you want help, you can’t expect us to look at a piece of code and know the errors from it.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww
item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

[quote=“cows1471, post:2, topic:297427”]yer

add this instead

	if (p.getEquipment().get(3).getDefinition().getId() == 773) {
			int rangeDamage = 255;
			int meleeDamage = 255;
	} else {
			int rangeDamage = math.random(maxHitRange());
			int meleeDamage = math.random(maxHitMelee());
	}

}

remember for every { there must b a }[/quote]

WRONG SIR.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww

item.description:
@cows1471 wrote:

yer

add this instead

	if (p.getEquipment().get(3).getDefinition().getId() == 773) {
			int rangeDamage = 255;
			int meleeDamage = 255;
	} else {
			int rangeDamage = math.random(maxHitRange());
			int meleeDamage = math.random(maxHitMelee());
	}

}

remember for every { there must b a }

item.title: Compile errors, ewwwww
item.dc:creator: @Wildfire Wildfire
item.description:
@Wildfire wrote:

if (p.getEquipment().get(3).getDefinition().getId() == 773) { int rangeDamage = 255; int meleeDamage = 255; } else { int rangeDamage = math.random(maxHitRange()); int meleeDamage = math.random(maxHitMelee()); }

It gives me a TON of cannot find symbol messages lower down. Did I do something wrong?

Read full topic
